Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to override Governor Paterson’s veto of A. 2565 and its companion bill, S. 2664, legislation that would amend the Social Services Law to provide that persons living with clinical/symptomatic HIV/AIDS, who are receiving shelter assistance or an emergency shelter allowance, shall not be required to pay more than 30 percent of their household’s monthly income towards shelter costs, including rent and utilities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Provide that persons living with clinical/symptomatic HIV/AIDS, who are receiving shelter assistance or an emergency shelter allowance, shall not be required to pay more than 30 percent of their household’s monthly income towards shelter costs, including

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to override Governor Paterson’s veto of A. 2565 and its companion bill, S. 2664, legislation that would amend the Social Services Law to provide that persons living with clinical/symptomatic HIV/AIDS, who are receiving shelter assistance or an emergency shelter allowance, shall not be required to pay more than 30 percent of their household’s monthly income towards shelter costs, including rent and utilities.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
